comment.text: This translation key is used to display the price per admin/user per year in a user interface. It typically appears as part of a payment or pricing information section, and its value will be determined by either `startValue` or `priceManagerPerMonth`, depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'per admin' is not accurately translated. 'مشرف' (mushref) means 'supervisor' or 'administrator', but the nuance of 'per admin' (meaning 'per user with administrative privileges') is lost. A more accurate translation might consider using a phrase conveying 'per user with admin rights' or similar.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'لكل مستخدم يتمتع بصلاحيات إدارية' (likulli mustakhdim yatamaata'a bisalaahiyat idariyya) - 'per user with administrative privileges'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "per admin/year" is not accurately translated. "Per admin/year" implies a cost per administrator per year. The Azerbaijani translation, "administrator/il başına," is more literal and doesn't convey the intended meaning of 'per administrator per year'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: administrator başına/il

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The original English text uses double tags <1>...</1> around the variables. The Azerbaijani translation mirrors this formatting. It's unclear if this is necessary or if a different format should be used for Azerbaijani.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the intended use of the tags and adjust accordingly. It might be simpler to remove them or use a different tag format.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'per admin/year' is not accurately translated. 'admin' should be translated to 'администратор' instead of 'админ'. Using 'админ' sounds informal and unprofessional.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'админ' with 'администратор'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'admin' is not directly translated. 'Správce' is a suitable translation, but a more natural phrasing might be 'uživatele s administrátorskými právy' or a similar construct to more clearly indicate user role.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{currencySymbol}}</1><1>{{price}}</1> na uživatele s administrátorskými právy/rok

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English source includes tags <1> and </1>. The Czech translation mirrors this formatting exactly. While not incorrect, it's worth checking if this formatting is necessary or whether it should be simplified or removed to match the intended display.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the <1> and </1> tags if they are not essential for display.  If they are, ensure consistency with the English version.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'per admin/year' has been translated to 'pro Administrator/Jahr'. While technically correct, 'pro Admin/Jahr' would be a more natural and concise translation in German, maintaining a similar brevity and flow as the original English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: pro Admin/Jahr

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'per admin/year' should be translated to convey 'per usuario/año' or 'por usuario/año' to accurately reflect 'per user/year'. The current translation 'por administrador/año' focuses on the admin role and not the user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: por usuario/año

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Finnish translation uses 'pääkäyttäjä' which translates to 'main user' or 'super user'. The English content refers to 'admin', which could also be translated as 'ylläpitäjä' or a more general 'käyttäjä'. 'Pääkäyttäjä' implies a higher level of access than simply an 'admin'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'ylläpitäjä' or 'käyttäjä' to more accurately reflect 'admin'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'per admin/year' should be translated to reflect the French equivalent of 'per user/year'. 'Admin' is a direct borrowing and may not be the most natural phrasing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: par utilisateur/année

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "յուրաքանչյուր ադմինի/տարվա համար" is a literal translation of "per admin/year". A more natural and idiomatic Armenian translation for "per admin/year" would be something like "մեկ ադմին/տարվա համար" or "յուրաքանչյուր տարվա համար մեկ ադմին".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: մեկ ադմին/տարվա համար

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'per amministratore/anno' is too literal. A more natural Italian phrasing would be 'per utente/anno' or 'a utente/anno'. 'Amministratore' implies a person actively managing something, while 'utente' (user) is more suitable in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: per utente/anno

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "管理者/年あたり" is a literal translation of "per admin/year" but sounds unnatural in Japanese. A more natural phrasing would be something like "管理者1人あたり年間" or "年間あたりの管理者数".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 管理者1人あたり年間 or 年間の管理者数

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "per admin/year" is not perfectly translated. While "관리자 한 명당" correctly conveys "per admin", the addition of "/년" at the end is slightly awkward. A more natural Korean phrasing might integrate the 'year' element more smoothly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 관리자 1인당 <1>{{currencySymbol}}</1><1>{{price}}</1>/년 or 관리자 1인당 <1>{{currencySymbol}}</1><1>{{price}}</1> 연간

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the tags <1>{{currencySymbol}}</1> and <1>{{price}}</1> seem a little awkward due to their placement relative to the Korean phrasing. They interrupt the flow of the sentence slightly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider re-evaluating the placement of the tags to maintain readability in the translated context. Ideally, they should be positioned to feel more natural within the Korean sentence structure.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ຕໍ່ປີສໍາລັບຜູ້ບໍລິຫານ' directly translates to 'per year for administrator'. While technically correct, it lacks the nuance of 'admin' which implies a role or user type. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of 'ຕໍ່ປີສໍາລັບຜູ້ໃຊ້ບໍລິຫານ' (per year for administrator user) or 'ຕໍ່ປີສໍາລັບບັນຊີຜູ້ບໍລິຫານ' (per year for administrator account).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຕໍ່ປີສໍາລັບຜູ້ໃຊ້ບໍລິຫານ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Latvian translation "beheerder/jaar" appears to be a mix of Dutch and a potential misinterpretation of "admin/year". It doesn't accurately translate 'admin/year' into Latvian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider translating 'admin/year' to something like 'lietotājs/gads' or 'administratora/gads' depending on the intended meaning and context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of "beheerder/jaar" suggests a combined word which might be problematic for parsing or display. It's more standard to have distinct words.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Separate 'beheerder' and 'jaar' and potentially add a space between them.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'admin' was translated as 'beheerder'. While 'beheerder' is a valid translation, it might not be the most natural or common way to refer to an administrator in this context. 'Administrator' or a more specific term depending on the application might be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'administrator' or researching the most common term for 'admin' within the target Dutch-speaking user base.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'per admin/year' is not accurately translated. 'admin' should be 'użytkownika' or 'administratora' in Polish to maintain the intended meaning of 'per user/year'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{price}}</1><1>{{currencySymbol}}</1> za użytkownika/rok

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The order of the currency symbol and price is reversed compared to the English version.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{currencySymbol}}</1><1>{{price}}</1> za użytkownika/rok

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'per admin/year' is not the most natural way to express this in Portuguese. It's a literal translation from English and feels awkward. A more natural phrasing would be 'por usuário/ano' or 'por usuário por ano'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: por usuário/ano

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "per admin/year" is not the most natural way to express this in Portuguese.  'Por administrador/ano' is a literal translation, but a more natural phrasing would be 'por usuário/ano' or 'por usuário, anualmente'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: por usuário/ano

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'per admin/year' has been translated as 'pe administrator/an'. While understandable, 'per administrator/an' is not the most natural Romanian phrasing. A more accurate and fluent translation would be 'per administrator/an' or 'pe administrator pe an'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider revising to 'pe administrator/an' or 'pe administrator pe an'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'per admin/year' is not accurately translated. 'Per admin/year' implies 'per administrator per year'. The Russian translation 'на администратора в год' directly translates to 'per administrator in year', which is correct but potentially reads slightly awkwardly in Russian. A more natural phrasing would be 'на администратора в год' or 'на одного администратора в год'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to 'на одного администратора в год' for improved clarity and flow.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation "පරිපාලකයාට" translates to "to an administrator". It should convey "per administrator" or something equivalent to match the English phrase "per admin".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: පරිපාලකයා බැගෙයි

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation preserves the <1> tags from the original English. These tags are not necessary in Sinhala and should be removed or adapted to the Sinhala translation’s structure if required.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> tags from the translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation 'za administrátor/rok' is grammatically incorrect and doesn't accurately convey "per admin/year". The correct Slovak would be 'na administrátora/rok' or 'na používateľa/rok' depending on the intended meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: na administrátora/rok

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "admin" is not accurately translated to "skrbnika/leto". "Skrbnika" translates to 'caretaker/guardian' which doesn't fully convey the meaning of 'admin' in a software context. A more accurate translation might be "administratorja/leto" or a descriptive phrase depending on the specific context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "administratorja/leto" or a contextually appropriate alternative to 'admin'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation 'по администратору/годишње' doesn't accurately reflect the English phrase 'per admin/year'.  'по администратору' translates to 'per administrator' which is functionally correct, but 'годишње' should be more naturally translated as 'годишње'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{currencySymbol}}</1><1>{{price}}</1> по администратору/годишње

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'per admin' should be translated more naturally into Serbian. 'Po administratoru' is literal but sounds awkward. A better phrasing would be 'za administratora' or 'na administratora'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: po administratoru -> za administratora or na administratora

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The order of the placeholders `{{price}}` and `{{currencySymbol}}` is reversed compared to the English version. The English version has the currency symbol first, then the price. The Turkish version has the price first, then the currency symbol. This change could be confusing to users.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Reorder the placeholders to match the English version: "Yıl başına yönetici <1>{{currencySymbol}}</1><1>{{price}}</1>"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'per admin' is not accurately reflected in the Ukrainian translation. 'На адміністратора' directly translates to 'per admin,' but a more natural Ukrainian phrasing would be something like 'на одного адміністратора' (per one admin) or 'для адміністратора' (for an admin).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: за одного адміністратора

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Vietnamese translation contains extra spaces after the closing tag </1>. These spaces should be removed to match the formatting of the original English content.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the extra spaces after the closing tag </1>. The translation should be: <1>{{currencySymbol}}</1><1>{{price}}</1> mỗi quản trị viên/năm

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "admin/year" is not accurately translated. "每位管理员/年" literally translates to "per administrator/year". While understandable, it lacks the nuance of the English 'admin'. Using a more common industry term for 'admin' would be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 每位管理員/年 (using the more common term for 'admin' in Chinese)
